TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE and residing in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant had a car accident at a junction . The traffic police fined him for the decriminalised offence of " not slowing down while approaching the junction and thus causing danger " ( per non aver moderato la velocità all'intersezione costituendo pericolo ) . The fine amounted to MONEY .
On DATE the applicant filed an objection with the Prefect of Milan through ORG . He contested that he had partly caused the accident and also requested that he himself and an eye - witness be heard .

The applicant 's objection was received by the Judicial Police on DATE and sent back to ORG with a view to obtaining information on DATE . On CARDINAL DATE the file was forwarded to another section of ORG .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant asked the ORG to issue a decision . He received no reply .
The applicant 's file was never forwarded to ORG , which learned about its existence only in the context of the application to ORG .
The road traffic offence is nowadays time - barred .

In the meantime , the applicant claimed compensation for the damage occurred to his car , but the insurance company only paid CARDINAL of the amount claimed , on the ground that the applicant was partly responsible for the accident .
B. Relevant domestic law and practice

According to Sections CARDINAL - CARDINAL of FAC ( GPE della Strada ) , a person who has been fined for a road traffic offence can file an objection with the competent ORG . The lodging of the objection suspends the effects of the fine . The ORG , within DATE , can either confirm the fine and issue an order for its payment or issue a reasoned order withdrawing the fine ( ordinanza motivata di archiviazione degli atti ) . The party can file an application with the civil Magistrate against a negative decision of the ORG .
ORG , by judgments ORG . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG and CARDINAL , has interpreted Section CARDINAL of LAW as allowing to apply to the Magistrate without previously applying to the Prefect .

In several decisions ( Nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) ORG has applied the principle stated by ORG and ruled that the application to the ORG is merely optional , i.e. it is possible to apply directly to the Magistrate .

ORG has also made it clear , by its decision No . CARDINAL , that the above DATE time - limit is peremptory and that , therefore , a decision delivered after the expiry of DATE is to be considered invalid .
According to LAW , road traffic offences become time - barred after DATE .

According to Section CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure , the content of a public document ( atto pubblico ) - such as a traffic police fine - can be challenged in the course of civil proceedings through a written application ( querela di falso ) to the judge .

In its judgment no . CARDINAL of DATE , ORG has made clear that a possible withdrawal of the fine by the ORG , being no judicial decision , can not prevent the civil courts from establishing the possible responsibility of the relevant person in relation to the facts which are the object of the fine .
